content.text: Login Test Scenario 1: Login With Invalid Credentials
Goal: Ensure the login functionality works as intended when the user has entered the invalid credentials.
Users enter application URL and navigate to the login page; OR Users enter application login URL directly
Users enter invalid credentials on the “Email” and “Password” input field

fields.summary: As a user, I want to be able to register an account to the website so that I can access to the website functionality.

content.text: To outline the testing approach, scope, and objectives for the website's login feature.
To verify that users are able to log in to the website and access their accounts.
The test will cover the login functionality of the website.
The test will be conducted manually and automatically using the Katalon Studio automation tool.
The test will be conducted on a web-based application on various web browsers.
The test will be designed and conducted in both positive and negative scenarios.
The test will be conducted in the following test environments:
Verify that users can log in using valid credentials.
Verify that users can log out after logging in.
Verify that users cannot log in using invalid credentials.
Verify that users cannot log in with a deactivated account.
Verify that users cannot log in with an account that has exceeded the maximum login attempts.
The test cases will be executed according to the test plan.
The test results will be documented and reported and attached as the reference below.

issuetype.description: Stories track functionality or features expressed as user goals.
issuetype.name: Story

fields.summary: As a user of the system, I want to be able to log in to the website so that I can access my account.
